intro: Phyllactis densa, commonly known as the dense phyllactis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its woody stems and broad, palmate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
